I have watched it 10 more times since then and it never ceases to mesmerize me every single time.

This is a fast paced movie that starts as an innocent love story of a hindu boy and a muslim girl and take turns to explore different genres like a drama, polytical satire and much more. Dhanush will remain my favorite Indian actor for the rest of my life, such was his performance in this movie. Jeesan Ayyub and Swara Bhaskar deserve special mention for their powerful performances too. All the little characters of this movie played their roles to almost perfection. I can't find too many plot holes anywhere in the movie. The castings were perfect. Perhaps no one would better suit the role Abhay Deol played. Sonam did her job alright. The music touches the heart and totally amalgamates with the movie. You would never really feel like avoding any of the songs unlike many bollwood movies where the songs are there just to be there. The masterful music of this movie brings it to life and the story keeps moving forward with the songs.

On top of all the good things like the acting, screenplay, the twists/turns, the climax left me speechless (beyond imagination); such was the power of Raanjhanaa. Only a 10 star can do justice to this movie.

If you are an audience who can appreciate and understand movies that are larger than life and are yet to experience this movie, just sit tight and watch a movie that you will remember for the rest of your life.

How far would you go to prove that you can do anything in the world for the love of your life ? Raanjhana showcases how a person lives and dies each day only to make someone happy for the rest of life.

The movie takes you on journey with Kundan who is brilliantly plated by Dhanush right from his school days in Banaras to his ultimate destiny. Its very hard not to feel for the guy and cheer him, laugh with him, feel with him and it definitely makes one nostalgic and teary eyed at the same time.

There are many amazing sequences in the film which are so realistic that you can really feel the main man crying, smiling ,puking at various stages of the movie. His transformation from a school boy with a crush, through a youth with stubble and only one real goal in life, to an atonement seeking person is palpable.

Mind you though its made to be a love story it almost never gets into stereotypes or clichés and keeps us on the edge of the seat with its thrilling twists throughout the course.

Of course the main character is aided by a wonderful support cast from his friend Murrari who gets the best one-liners, his childhood girlfriend, Abhay Deol who plays his role with ease and surprisingly Sonam Kapoor who has dared to do something different & succeeded.

But the movies greatest strength is Dhanush who can make you cheer for him even when he's slashing his wrist, or riding is love into the river when he realizes she in love with somebody else. And the places were the shoot have done in city Benaras have its own charm with the taste of mythology and the some spice of love of two different religion.

On the flip side his role as a political leader seems over stretched after the racy 1st half and some of the actions of the lead female towards the end are not understandable.

All in all if you want to watch desi realistic love story with raw human emotions and unpolished drama here's your chance. Don't miss it!

Thank You.

review_title: Great story but Overly cliché and laboured
review_detailed_main: Romantic comedies are essentially my guilty pleasure (psst... don't pass the word around), often intaking a few to lessen the intensity levels following more ambitious cinema. Despite being able to fill in the dots several scenes ahead, they do offer a certain respite and touch the less cynical side of a human being.They end up attempting to talk there way into the viewer's sympathy with mildly entertaining punchlines, forced deliveries reeking of pretentiousness or mistimed comedic flow.The best thing in the movie is Dhanush. He simply stole the show with his intense portrayal of a person driven by love, a person who does the most stupid, brave and incomprehensible of things in the name of love.

just one word fabulous. unique story,wonderful plot,and superb acting.After ages i saw a good love story. outstanding performance by Sonam Kapoor, Dhanush, and Zeeshan Ayub. Awesome music by A.R. Rahman and lyrics by irshad kamil. request to those who not yet watch this movie, go to your nearest theater and have a look. I am sure you will find yourself in raanjhanaa. Raanjhanaa is not only a love story. It is much more than that.he loved the girl from his childhood and he crossed his heart and hope to die.love is immortal.love is divine.love do not know cast. if you love someone then never give up.One day she/he will come to your life. Raanjhanaa is not only a love story. It is much more than that. Just have a look and i am sure you will say only one word. it is just awesome. Raanjhanaa hua me tera. kaun tere bin mera.

There are all sorts of viewer out there but what everybody likes to see and wants to see is a performance distinctive and unique. Yes this is said in praise of Dhanush as Kundan. Exceptionally something worth watching. unfortunately it didn't screen in Pakistan ( n I'll never understand why). The movie has a lot to give to you. I have been waiting to see raanjhnaa for a long time and it has proved that all that waiting was worth it. Raanjhnaa is quite different from usual Bollywood romantic movies. The character development is amazing and a special mention can be made in regard of Kundan(Dhanush). The movie carries its pace and attention very well in the first half. The music matches the situation exceptionally well hats off to A.R Rehman. Apart from that the dialogs are very witty. A piece of advice don't take this movie literally ;) It has a lot to offer, just be willing to gain something n u will empathize with characters.

review_title: Ready for a Roller coaster Ride which bangs your heart and mind
review_detailed_main:
Friends I had just went through the superb experience of pure Bollywood movie which proves that we can also create movies where Hollywood seems beggar. Our culture, cast, religion and a love story with simplicity and complexity, friendship, love triangle, You can experience all this here in RAANJHANAA. Dhanush proves that looks doesn't matter if you really do the justice with acting. Every character have done a great job.

Movie starts with light moments and move towards the complications of love. Dialogues are well written which makes you laugh time to time and having a pure touch of Banaras. What can I say about the music. Afterall it is again A.R. Rehman who set the new benchmark for musicians and for himself too.

Overall I liked this movie very much and recommend all the readers to watch it. Thanks

review_title: Simply Awesome!! Worth watching love story
review_detailed_main: Very practical and earthy story spiced up in the context of childhood crushes and practical love. Sonam portrays the character of confused and vulnerable yet practical girl with ease. Abhay deol's cameo leaves a great impression. But the life of the movie is Dhanush. That guy takes the movie on his shoulders and carries the burden effortlessly. Muraari's timed punches keep the mood light even in sad scenes. You feel bad for Bindiya throughout the movie. The best scene in the movie is when Dhanush hugs Sonam tightly and tells her that he doesn't love her because she is beautiful, even it would have been some other girl he would have loved that girl immensely and that its nothing to do with Sonam being pretty. For rest, please go and watch the movie yourself. The climax is a big time surprise.

review_title: A fresh new approach to love stories
review_detailed_main:
It is a story about one-sided love of a small town boy Kundan. Like his ways or not, you can not help yourself but feel for him. The best part is, the characters are so real, that you can easily connect with them.

Acting is great whether its the lead pair of Dhanush and Sonam or the supporting actors like Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub and Swara Bhaskar. A Hindi movie debut for south superstar Dhanush could not have been better than this. His common man look only help his character come out to be more real and likable.

Rehman's Music is good and goes well with the narrative, specially the title track, Tum tak, Piya.

Story is fresh, not a typical bollywood love story. The regular twist and turns keep your interest in the movie intact. The dialogues are the main hero of this movie, specially the one-liners. Kudos to Himanshu for his writing and Anand L. Rai for trying to be different.The only setback is it seems to be two different movies, pre-intreval and post-interval.Not disconnected though, the pace and the environment changes drastically post interval. Which takes a while for one to fit into the mood.

Overall a must watch love story.

review_title: A must watch movie for everyone
review_detailed_main: guys please do watch out this movie.don't go on the looks of Dhanush.. once the movie starts he would steal your heart ,n will make u fall in love with his character. He is just an amazing actor n to watch out for.he delivered an endearing performance. A brilliant script ,nt just another normal love story,gives u smile,pain,suspense,laughter,love everything..Regarding others performance so Sonam Kapoor did a brilliant job in her role. A very good performance given by her. She also delivered fab performance.Rest supporting cast also played well enough. Dialogues are like epic. Simply unforgettable. I would give this movie 11/10 I watched a very good movie after a long time as was tired watching crap movies from our bollywood. But this movie needs standing ovation. Everything is just too perfect. I never wrote such review for any movie . But this movie is magnificent and epic movie so cant resist myself from writing for it. It would make place in your heart for quite long time i must say. Or even lifetime u never know :) . Just go ahead and watch this ,you should not miss it. You wont regret watching it :)

review_title: Can i have my 2.5 hours back ?
review_detailed_main: Rates 7.8 (! at the time of writing this review) You got to be sh!tting me. This is no better than the cr4p bollywood has been dishing out for the last 10 years. In fact this is one of the worst I have seen in recent times. Over the top acting by Dhanush, cheesy dialogs, over emotional characters ready to slit their wrists for just about anything and a cr4ppy story to top it all. Wondering if there is anymore you can add to this steaming pile of sh!t. Music is very disappointing too. The only song worth listening to was a stolen retro song... this is not how you want to project the Indian youth or how you want Indian youth to engage in politics. All you people rating it so high must be a hired lot 'cause no one in his/her right state of mind would give it anything over 1.

some love stories are perfect when left incomplete and of its kinds is ranjhanna... it was nothing new in the concept of the movie yet the presentation was unprecedented.

a young boy who fall in love with a girl whom he saw while raising fund and spend years in waiting only to realize that the girl love someone else and never thought of him any thing more than a bailout option..

a girl who was kept away from committing teen age mistakes by her parents only to be done later when she grows up. falling for a guy from a different religion and creating chaos , and what all over shadow in the movie in the first half is charm of banaRAS or i would say the essence is what catch your eye ,the local slang , narrow street and blend of love. the first part of movie ends in midst of broken hearts and some broken bones only to build up for intriguing second half.

second half starts touch slow and could only be the only possible flaw in the movie still i would not consider it as a flaw. after all moon looks perfect with the dark spot on it. the chaos created before needs to be set right and our hero takes the responsibility in his own hands to do it by the way of reparation , but destiny has something else in store for him and the things fell all over the places for him. a death ,a shattered soul ,a family left behind. and than the resurgence where he tries all his might to win over again the battle of love through his born qualities of being a banarasi .

sonam kapoor has finally shown some acting skills murai (Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub) stole the show with his banarasi one liners and punches and then their is dhanush like a silver lining for many of those who thinks acting matters more than the looks would just love to ask him .. why so late is dis kolaveri DI..

its a must watch. and anand rai deserves credit for this one....

review_title: a nice romantic up and down with a great ending......
review_detailed_main: Raanjhanaa a movie focused on love and it's different up and downs.It was directed by Anand L Rai,and he did work well too.The plot of the movie is about a small town boy Kundan and a small town girl Zoya .Despite of their religion differences Kundan loves Zoya from his childhood.He proposes Zoya .after lots of chasing and slaps he manages to convince Zoya.but when Zoya's dad discovers about his daughters love affairs with an Hindu boy, he sends her to Lucknow.After eight years of this Kundan dose not forgets Zoya.when Zoya returns to Banaras ,she dose not recognizes Kundan.now the actual plot starts about the past of Zoya and the miseries that Kundan suffers for her.The movie concludes at a note of ever loving spirit of Kundan.Casting of this movie was good.Dhanush has good acting skills but his trouble in speaking Hindi quite shows . Sonam Kapoor was better then her last performances,Abhay Deoyl was good too.The character of Murari was also good.The movie was good and its songs were also enjoyable.

review_title: Ranjhnaa is a realistic love story rather than another regular Bollywood romcom
review_detailed_main:
Ranjhnaa is defined by two of the dialogues – "Girls and rocket can take man anywhere" and "You are not Shahrukh Khan that girl will fall in love with you because of you persistently following her , so become Vinod Mehra". Ranjhnaa is story of Kundan(Dhanush)wooing the girl(Sonam)from start till end . He starts by following Shahrukh pattern( expressive show of emotion and following the girl )to Vinod Mehra pattern( staying near girl and helping her silently) to woo her.

First half is fun and moves very fast. But the second half where he follows Vinod Mehra charter of romance(being with the girl, helping her silently in whatever way possible),the romance part takes back stage but still being undertone of the new situations kundan have been thrown into because of this girl. The climax is letdown as the twist and/or the shock factor they were trying to put in, hasn't come through well, as seeing the development and behavior of the characters it was evident what's going to happen.

Dhanush is brilliant as lover who is crazy after the girl - Sometimes getting fooled knowingly to keep his love happy like a true blue lover and sometimes resentful and hurting her.

Dhanush plays the role of lover with so much passion that his act is most endearing one. Sonam looked beautiful and played the role of a girl who uses her beauty to get her work done with great innocence. Mohammad Zeeshan and Swara Bhaskar are also terrific. Abhay deol was good , though there isn't much for him to do

But all these performances are enhanced by some brilliant one liners and dialogues which look convincing and are actually hilarious makes one ROFL

review_title: Better than most cliché Bolly offerings...
review_detailed_main: Raanjhanaa is anything but cliché,unique in so different ways unlike most Bolly offerings these days.First you have an unconventional hero, who can act and look the role he is playing (He actually looks like a 9th grade student at the age of 30 as he did in "3"). He impressed previously in 3 or Aadakulam.He might not be as good here but his effortless act is most definitely one big reason for which the film clicks.Secondly you have a role written for a Bolly mainstream female lead which has so many shades that any actress with even decent acting skills could have made a career out of it.Sonam won't,no surprises.She looks BEAUTIFUL nevertheless.I am not sure who in India could have looked so beautiful,young and yet do justice to this fantastic role-but in case choice was necessary acting should have been preferred over looks. :( .Thirdly you have two genuine actors, playing the supporting acts and giving the best performances in the film.Not Abhay Deol (though he is good in cameo),its Md.Zeeshan Ayuub and Swara Bhaskar (she was even better in Listen Amayaa & Aurangzeb) who stays with you way more than anyone else. But the biggest positive aspect that the film delivers, are its characters.Each of them are so very real,with so many shades and flaws that you can relate.The relentless hero cursing his love being rejected,the scheming heroine spitting on the hero-Raanjhaana does have a coming of age effect working for it.It has a genuine story though the screenplay, primarily in the 2nd half fails.With a very vibrant,fast and effective 1st half ,the film suddenly looses its steam in the 2nd, trying to push itself in uncomfortable zone (read politics).With more than a few far-fetched sequences,unnecessary comic reliefs & punch lines and a stiff Sonam lingering around, Raanjhanaa loses its holds,falters.Rehman too does not help with his tunes, though the background music is pretty good.But then you often move helter skelter while trying some new road,only promising to improve in the next venture.Anand Rai does exactly so and gives a far better love-story than the cliché,bore to the core YJHD.

Awesome movie by the director. Above all, its Dhanush throughout. A brilliant actor and a brilliant performance. Not even the main stream Hindi movie actors can think of to deliver performance near to Dhanush. Performance of a truly National Award winner. Good music by Rehmaan. Songs are great and beautifully pictured. You will feel the essence of Banaras throughout the movie. It could be considered as one of the best love stories ever made in India. Sonam Kapoor have also delivered the best performance of her carrier. Dialogues well written and will give you the feel of UP language and the way how young boys interact with friends in UP.

End is good and the last dialog by Dhanush will make you leave the cinema halls with smile. A must watch movie. 9/10

Initially I was sceptic about this movie. I assumed a different story from the trailer. A story full of romance and clichés. A story which was bound to have a good first half and boring second half. Well, I am right about the second half. Post interval the movie slows down very much, at times drags then after few minutes beating around the bushes it concludes with a good ending.

Theme: "The pundit's son Kundan (Dhanush) has fallen for the girl at first sight. That they're both kids makes us dismiss it as a meaningless crush. But a few years later, the boy is still in love with the girl, Zoya (Sonam Kapoor). When she's in school, he follows her around holding her hand and getting slapped in the process. Finally, she relents because of his "consistency". The film shifts cities when Zoya gets into JNU (Jawaharlal Nehru University), and through her, we are introduced to the idealistic and political culture of the place. She discovers a long-lost strength as she confronts and then falls for student leader Abhay Deol. The film takes a turn when Zoya returns to her hometown after eight long years only to find some things changed, and others surprisingly the same"

Character development: This movie is stands on the shoulder of two leads Sonam as Zoya and Dhanush as Kundan. But, mainly zoya's character goes through any development. Say it mentality, expectation from life, treating situations. Dhanush kind of stops growing emotionally. Most of the time he learns that things have changed in and around Zoya and impacts him momentarily but does not change him or his mentality towards Zoya. I would say Dhanush's character in this regards does not go through much changes in the movie.

Direction: The movie has a very unconventional script and putting that to frame could not have been easy but Anand Rai did a marvelous job. If only he thought about anything about post interval scenes. Dhanush is used to the fullest and he proves he's here to stay. But more praise goes to Anand Rai for bringing out a convincing performance from Sonam Kapoor. This movie won't win her any award but might help her land some good roles. And if she stick around like Deepika, she might improve. Next praise of the direction is the scene construction. There are few gems in the movie. Specially mentioned would be the gas cylinder scene, scooter into Ganges and Dhanush vomiting scene. Anand Rai got an excellent script and did a marvelous job portraying it into movie.

Cinematography: Cinematography is apt to the situations.

Acting:Dhanush is superb. This is a tailor made role from him and him only. His looks and his physique complements the movie. Then add his brilliant acting talent, the way he speaks, his body language is brilliant. People talk about chemistry between lead pairs but here Kundan(Dhanush) and Murari's chemistry surpassed everything. Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub as Murari did a solid job and at times shadowed Dhanush. Sonam here dared to do a very tough role. Her role was the most strong role in the movie and even tougher than the Priyanka's role in Barfi. Her character goes through various changes in the movie, jealousy, love, revenge, guilt, passion everything comes into her role. We are grateful that she pulled that off somehow, else it would have been a torture to tolerate her in a movie like that. Swara Bhaskar as Bindiya did a very good job. I really liked the scenes where Murari, Kundan Bindiya fight with each other. Rest of the characters are average does not require a special mention here.

Songs and background score: Only one song i.e. 'Tum Tak' I found apt to the situation rest do not contribute to the movie. I would appreciate the background score here more than actual songs.

Editing: Can't have mercy on the editor for the bad second half. Few unnecessary scenes could have been avoided.

Entertainment value: Till first half this movie would entertain you later you might get bored but the ending is good.

review_title: Would you fight for love the way Dhanush does?
review_detailed_main:
A blend of malevolent passion, coupled with naive desire, Raanjhanaa tells a tale of a soul desperate for approval - seldom played or mastered by south Indian stars, specifically as a breakout role in a new language. However, Dhanush intricately weaves his craft into the role, donning a new persona as the posterized "lover-boy" burdened by Sonam Kapoor's lack of interest. With a powerful score orchestrated by none other than the maestro himself, A. R. Rahman picks up the films notes whenever Anand L. Rai falters. Nonetheless, Rai's directorship simply embodies his talent: boundless.

A brisk start with a gripping, bubbly, and at times heart-wrenching performance from its supporting cast (you didn't seriously think Abhay Deol would disappoint?), Rai uses his talented cast to deconstruct masala-esque themes and dismantle the heavily leaned-upon pillars of Bollywood's (and at time Kollywood's) rom-com tropes. Of course, he brilliantly interlinks comedic elements, and no amount of praise can hope to accommodate Dhanush's powerhouse performance.

While the cast, the characters, and the themes hold up a lengthy 2 and a half hour runtime, one must ask themselves: "was it justified?" A brilliant film that I certainly would dub a masterpiece had I only watched the first 40 and last 40 minutes; it's auteur lacks one thing: conciseness. My only negative remarks would include the unfortunate feeling of a piece of gum that'd been over-chewed - it simply lost its flavour over the course of time. As many films undergo a thorough editing process, perhaps Rai could've left a couple more scenes on the cutting room floor, but luckily for the director, Rahman tugs at our heartstrings, and pulls us through these drab 20 minutes in the middle with herculean strength.

Overall, Raanjhanaa is a film that I consider to be fantastic, and a definite watch for anyone.

review_title: One of the best romantic movie of decade
review_detailed_main: Ranjhanaa:A s the name says, Dhanush had done exact acting. Terrific performance. His acting skills is way above good. After all he is Rajnikant's son-in-law. Sonam is average! Swara Bhaskar is another main ingredient in this recipe. Fab script and screenplay is main punch of the movie. Director Aanand Rai has handled this tough-bit complex-fusion script so easily that you won't find any fault and the movie is easy going. The team of Tanu Weds Manu brings this drama of Love, Politics, Jealousy, Power, Friendship etc. all in a single movie. I completely agree with the second half and the beautiful climax of this movie. JUST WATCH IT!

I was really impressed by the music as well as lustrous & vibrant movie posters. So my expectation from Raanjhanaa (2013) was quite high.

The first half hour was really nice, but after that the tempo began to fall; sometimes high, sometimes low. Although they tried to put several twists in the story, but none of them clicked well. The script (by Himanshu Sharma) was not well composed; seemed like "links missing". It was tough to find or relate what the writer wants to tell and where he wants to go, may be it was because of immature editing (by Hemal Kothari)!

This movie reminded me of Saawariya (2007)! That was one man show by Ranbir Kapoor; here's the same, one man show by Dhanush. The similarity and reminding point is Sonam Kapoor; in both, she was really very flat. This is the point where she needs to improve a lot. She looked uncomfortable in the role. She looks young and beautiful, but all she needs is to act.

Dhanush was flawless throughout the film. He was perfect for the character than Shaheed Kapoor. May be more Bollywood is coming for the boy. Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub (as Murari) and Swara Bhaskar (as Bindiya) did splendid job with their roles.

If there was no A R Rahman involvement with this cinema, this might be a disaster! What to say, all the tracks were unique in their genres. The vocal Percussion & vocal Shehnai by Chinmayee and Aanchal Sethi for the song "Ay Sakhi" was remarkable. Melodic "Tum Tak" & crispy "Raanjhanaa" will provide piece in soul for a long period of time.

My actual rating is 3, but bonus 1.50 for A R Rahman & 0.50 for Dhanush making a total of 5. In a nutshell, not recommended; but can be seen at your own risk!

review_title: seriously....what director/writer want to show ?...(spoiler alert)
Very Strong Romantic Drama In The Backdrop Of Politics. ♦ 83%
review_detailed_main:
Dhanush's character, his portrayal & performance is one of the strong- points of Raanjhanaa. Other points are its throbbing music, supporting cast, colorful setup & fresh writing.

The first half, talking about the initial romance between two lead characters, is very powerful. It emotes total romance, humor & drama. Thirteen minutes into screenplay, the story is half-told, wonderfully. The next part shows aftermath. Abhay Deol enters and politics follows. Sentimental sequences make up almost three quarters of the second half and it actually paces the story. The climax is pure Bollywood ishtyle where the lead people react and evince the meaning of film as a whole. Wonderful!

Supporting cast is extremely potent, especially Dhanush's on-screen friend & that friend's sister. Their performances are terrific. A R Rahman's songs are truly extravagant, yet I felt repetitive use of lilts could've been done without. And I really doubt if Rahman has sampled Hans Zimmer towards the end. But, it doesn't matter because the hot theme actually mesmerizes you. There are many elements to consider and that itself is enough for considering this drama.

The experience as a whole was good enough for a Bollywood movie releasing among other clichéd films, because the makers know their audience and only reveal plot points when they think the story needs it.

BOTTOM LINE: A very strong cinema. Highly recommended! 8.3/10.

But movie belongs to trio of Dhanush the actor, Anand Rai the director and A.R.Rahman the music director. Dhanush in his first Bollywood outing makes you smile, laugh, dance, cry and even puke. Watch it for love, watch it for Rahman, watch it for break out debut of Dhanush in Bollywood.

review_title: A delightful intriguing love-story with fantastic twists --- 8/10---
Intense romantic dramas with strong performances and soulful music
review_detailed_main:
"Raanjhanaa" is a Hindi romantic drama film directed by Anand L. Rai, released in 2013. The movie stars Dhanush, Sonam Kapoor, and Abhay Deol in lead roles, with Swara Bhaskar and Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub in supporting roles.

Set in the city of Varanasi, "Raanjhanaa" tells the story of Kundan Shankar (Dhanush), a lower-middle-class Hindu boy who falls in love with Zoya Haider (Sonam Kapoor), a Muslim girl. The film explores their intense and passionate relationship, as well as the complexities of love, religion, and societal expectations.

One of the standout aspects of "Raanjhanaa" is the outstanding performances by the lead actors. Dhanush, a prominent Tamil actor making his Bollywood debut, delivers a remarkable performance as Kundan. He effectively portrays the innocence, vulnerability, and ardor of his character. Sonam Kapoor also shines in her role as Zoya, displaying a range of emotions and capturing the complexities of her character.

The film's music, composed by A. R. Rahman, is another highlight. The soundtrack features soulful melodies that beautifully complement the story and enhance the emotional impact of the scenes. Songs like "Tum Tak," "Raanjhanaa," and "Piya Milenge" have become popular and are still cherished by audiences.

The cinematography by Natarajan Subramaniam captures the essence of Varanasi, showcasing the vibrant colors, narrow lanes, and the city's spiritual atmosphere. The director, Anand L. Rai, does an excellent job of incorporating the city's cultural and religious elements into the narrative, creating a visually rich experience.

While "Raanjhanaa" received critical acclaim for its performances and music, it did receive some criticism for its handling of the portrayal of stalking and obsession in the name of love. Some viewers felt that the film romanticized such behaviors, which can be problematic and perpetuate harmful narratives.

Overall, "Raanjhanaa" is a visually appealing film with powerful performances and an engaging storyline. It explores the complexities of love and the clash of religious identities in a society deeply rooted in traditions. If you enjoy intense romantic dramas with strong performances and soulful music, "Raanjhanaa" is worth watching.

review_title: As raw as love can be!
review_detailed_main: Never had a Bollywood movie enthralled and entertained me as Raanjhanaa did since Gangs of Wasseypur. It is the most heart felt mind blowing experience you will ever have! Raanjhanaa is a love story, a story the like of which you have never seen before. It is an intense, raw steaming cauldron of love brimming with unprecedented passion where love consumes all. (It is just so so difficult to put down my thoughts on this one. But damn man, I am going to give it a try.) It is not your typical warm mushy love story, the kind that are you are so used to watching. It explores love in its truest, its purest form. There are moments where the scenes are so stupid, so clichéd that it seems to be taken from a very typical Bollywood movie, that you might have just laughed at its silliness. But wait for a few moments and those scenes will grow on you. And moreover how would one expect the translation of one's passion by a generation who has fed from Bollywood movies. The difference is startling when you see Sonam Kapoor's restrained, subtle love, not because it does not carry the intensity and passion of Dhanush's, but because it is the upbringing she gets. Sonam's love for Abhay is as raw as Dhanush's for Sonam. And here where the movie shines in the exploration of love. It studies two protagonists, both of whom shimmering with love and their affection directed at different persons, but at a metaphysical level united as one in their unbridled passion. It may seem to many that there is a lot of negativity with Sonam's character, be it the way she seeks Dhanush's help or later her actions result into his miserable condition. But if one looks closely at Dhanush's character you will see how closely Dhanush at the core is the same being. Apparently, people will naturally sympathize with Kundan and not with Zoya and thereby lies a major flaw in the treatment of the story. Since the two love stories reach the same dead end and the two characters are indistinguishable in their actions and deeds, it is inappropriate for one character to be portrayed in a more positive light than the other. Dialogues are very well written, many of which are witty and funny without taking away the intensity of the moments. They seem to blend with the characters, the landscape and the story seamlessly without ever feeling like just an addition to the ongoing surroundings to add to the entertainment. Dialogues never make any moment melodramatic or too fantastical to believe, they give an earthiness, a realism to the story that plays a pivotal role in making the movie so good. Dhanush has acted brilliantly and is really a talent house to look forward to. Sonam Kapoor has also given a good performance. Abhay Deol is wasted. The supporting cast is brilliant with Murari and BIndiya. The cinematography is also up to mark capturing the aesthetic of Varanasi on the celluloid. A. R. Rahman excels with this pitch perfect music direction. Raanjhanaa is a must watch for the love story that it is, a love story of fall and redemption that is not a fairy tale that culminates in the union, but a portrayal, a canvas where different true colours of love are splashed to make something so beautiful that it will remain forever etched out in my heart for eternity. In spite of all the tragedy and heart breaks, Raanjhanaa is not a sad movie. It is a celebration of love. Maybe sometimes it is just enough to love.
The movie " Raanjhaana " tries to portray love but ends up depicting another substance.

review_title: Rare to see such masterpiece in 2021.
review_detailed_main: It's all about true love, it's all about sacrifice, it's all about dedication, it's all about great story of younghood, it's about great writings, it's all about stong screen play.

Raanjhana is really a brilliant movie. Story was good and direction was good too. Acting was brilliant. Every actor acted really well. Dhanush, Sonam, Zeeshan Ayub and Swara Bhaskar played their roles beautifully. Dhanush made entry in Hindi Movieswith a masterpiece movie. You won't get bored of any scene in this movie. Dialogues were excellent and the dialogs made this film even more awesome. Abhay Deol played a small role in this film and as always he played his role well. The film was flawless. Many people could relate many scenes with their own life or story. This was the best bay Dhanush could have made his debut in the Bollywood. The climax of the film was the best part of the film or me.The film had 1 or 2 flaws like the overdose of slaps by Zoya in the didn't make much sense but the content of the story was brilliant. Overall this is a must watch movie for everyone out there.

review_title: A movie with a great story to tell
review_detailed_main: This turned out out to be a surprise hit for me. This is a love story throughout, but nothing terribly mushy or boring and certainly nothing typical of a Hindi romance. There is substance and a great story line here that keeps you engaged with the characters (even the side characters are hugely entertaining). There are some really funny moments and a few sad ones all combined to make a great story with no one over all mood. Dhanush plays his role very well and is destined for great things down the road. He sets a great example of putting your mind to something and tolerance towards being wronged. This is one of Sonam Kapoor's better movies and her role is excellent. The sets are real looking and it's refreshing to see no CGI, fake sets or green screened scenes. There is lots of color here and very real looking extras. The struggles between caste, religious differences and class divide are presented well with nothing glossed over. There are no super hero antics and no weird breakout dance scenes out of whack with the story. The music is excellent and goes well with each scene. An excellent movie that stands above the typical Bollywood stuff that is cranked out year after year.

Treat to watch, excellent story told keeping the soul and portraying all colors of real life be it love,trust,madness,friendship,betrayal,repent. AR Rehman is another man who with his amazing musical beats doesn't want The crux of the story is nothing but the unconditional love be it for the Murari or Kundan's child hood crush and one-sided love till the end to Kundan(Dhanush) and for Kundan's love for Zoya's.

The climax is unpredictable and take you all way though your heart when it comes, the last 10 minutes dialogue is not to be missed for anything.

I watched it when I was a kid so rewatched it again now & I can't stress enough on how mind blowing it is. I honestly can't remember when was the last time I was this moved by a romantic story. It has so much to offer the making, cast, dialogues (best part), screenplay, music BUT the bestest of bests is the splendid acting by Dhanush. No one could do justice to the lead role as he did. I became a fan truly. & It was Sonam's best career performance. I don't know why people don't talk about it as much as Kabir Singh, Rx 100 etc cz in terms it's WAYYY better.
